fields_of_interest: Agriculture, Education and training, Environment, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: BGCI convenes the European Botanic Gardens Consortium, which is an 'network of networks'. The Consortium consists representatives of the botanic garden networks of each European country. The Consortium focuses on supporting  European botanic gardens in relation to national and international biodiversity policy implementation, especially the Convention on Biological Diversity, the European Biodiversity Strategy and the Nagoya Protocol on Access and Benefit Sharing.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Consultation Forum on Access and benefit sharing (ABS)#E03396#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3396#Member#C
goals__remit: BGCI's mission is to mobilise botanic gardens and engage partners in securing plant diversity for the well-being of people and the planet.
relevant_communication: Through our membership, implementation of EU policies on biodiversity conservation, invasive alien species and access and benefit sharing.  BGCI, in partnership with the Council of Europe has published a Code of Conduct for botanic gardens on Invasive Alien Species. BGCI also works with European botanic gardens on education, communications and public awareness activites
